pull.title: doc: Remove newlines from error message
pull.body:
Fix accidental use of the addition assignment operator (`+=`).

_Note to reviewers:_ Perhaps the `\n`:s should be removed too?

events.body: Looks like there is only one other call that uses a newline, and this is going into `ThreadSafeMessageBox`, so I expect they're unnecessary.

How about also remove the last of the 3, in init.cpp? (found via `/InitError\(.+\\n/`)

That would also be an easy case to test how these look without newlines, because you can set the blocksdir to a non-existent location.

Tested ACK ee34012
Before:
```
$ src/bitcoind -blocksdir=somenonsense
Error: Specified blocks directory "somenonsense" does not exist.

$
```
After:
```
$ src/bitcoind -blocksdir=somenonsense
Error: Specified blocks directory "somenonsense" does not exist.
$ 
```

rename.from: wallet: Fix accidental use of the addition assignment operator ("+=")

rename.to: doc: Remove newlines from error message

events.message: Fix accidental use of the addition assignment operator ("+="). Remove newlines from error message.

events.body:
utACK 620361f.

Not all errors terminate with `.`, could be improved in a different PR?
